title: For Trade:  S&W 638 38 special +P
postcontent:
I have a 638 (also known as the bodygaurd) with the shrouded hammer for sale trade. It is in very good shape with very minor wear from being carried. It currently sports desantis clipgrips which is a fantastic way to carry these j frames without the need or bulk of a holster, I also have the original S&W grips that come with it. Also comes with 75 or so FMJ target rounds and a box of hornady critical defense 110gr +P JHP's which are thr best round for these J frames through thorough testing along with being less punishing in your hands in comparison to the 158gr +P rounds, the ballistics are very comparable to most 115gr +p 9mm rounds, so they pack quite a punch and shoot POA. The shrouded hammer gives you the best of both worlds - snag free like the 642 but you can still manually cock the hammer for 'precision' work. This gun also has had a professional trigger job with Wolff springs installed (tested it with the hardest primers out there, Sellier & Bellot) to ensure that it has no reliability issues - I also have the stock springs, it has a great trigger, especially the single action, I would estimate 8-9lb DA and 2lb or under SA, the DA is very, very smooth. I estimate the round count to be about 150.

I am mostly looking to trade this for a compact 9mm single stack, I have two of these and I've decided I would like to trade this one off since it's in better shape

title: For Sale:  Daniel Defense M4A1 Mil-spec brown with upgrades
postcontent: I have for sale a DD m4a1 Mil-spec brown rifle. The rifle had originally just under 200 or so rounds on it that I fired in 1 day at the range. Then I just had the barrel replaced with a new BCM mid length barrel, new gas tube and new gas block. The barrel has 0 rounds through it and is new. This will be a lot softer shooter then the carbine barrel that was with the rifle. I also replaced the CH with a BCM GF Mod 4 medium CH. I replaced the ugly DD furniture with a new Magpul FDE CTR stock and FDE K2 grip. With the BCM barrel install, I replaced the handguard with a BCM KMR13 that was professionally dipped by Tarjac in multicam. The multicam finish on the rail has some marks, chips in the finish from mounting accessories. Mainly under the front sight from it clamping down on the rail. The factory DD trigger was replaced with a brand new ALG ACT combat trigger that also has 0 rounds through it. Also included a brand new Noveske QD sling swivel. Also included is a Troy FDE HK style front sight. The sight came from another rifle and is not brand new like the other items, but is with the package. It comes in the factory DD case with manual, plastic, and the brand new in package PMAG that came with the rifle. All of the packages are all included from the new parts.. minus the K2 grip. The rifle shows some very minor normal use wear on the deflector, and the from where the dust cover hits the lower. Buyer is responsible for knowing his or her local laws. Pmag will be not shipped to banned areas. If kits are allowed, the mag will be disassembled. I have all positive feedback on Gunbroker, Ebay, and M4Carbine.  Will ship for 30 dollars.  Will come from individual to your FFL.  If your FFL wont accept from an individual, add 25 dollars for my transfer fee.  I accept USPS MO and or Certified bank check or Cash.  Will consider paypal gift.  Local transaction will be done at a FFL in Parker.  No exceptions.

title: For Sale:  Abosultely the Best Deal on Armslist - Quality Polish Makarov-Radom Arsenal 9x18 Model P83 Wanad w/2mags & holster
postcontent: The Wanad version is arguably the best of the Markarovs.  This is the real deal - Polish military/police Wanad P83 Makarov semi automatic pistol. Fires the readily available and inexpensive 9x18 round. This is a very robustly built shooter's gun.  These guns are in very good to excellent condition with only light holster wear. Even the holsters look good.  The Wanad version is arguably the best of the Markarovs. This is a surplus Polish police pistol. Comes with holster, cleaning rod and 2 magazines, cleaning rod, and a holster.  Most other sellers are including only 1 magazine. Capacity is 8 +1. All steel pistol with synthetic grips. Very well made at the Radon arsenal. Barrel is 3 1/2 inch, four groove right hand 1:9.83 rifling. Slide is serrated rear, .965 wide with axial dovetailed blade front sight and drift only windage adjustable dovetailed rear steel sight. Safety is slide mounted on the left side, for a right handed shooter. It serves as a decocker with some effort, and the P-83 safety is opposite from a Walther. Fire is down and safe is forward. The P83 does not have a firing pin safety or magazine safety. Double Action Trigger pull is 15 pound vicinity with 1 inch travels, and single action is 6 pound area with 1/2 inch travel and moderate felt creep. Overall length is 6 1/16 inches from the muzzle to the edge of the grip frame strut. Height is 4 3/4 inches from the top of the rear sight to the lowest portion of the magazine floorplate. Trigger is .310 serrated face alloy, with .360 serrated spur steel hammer. Dis-assembly is Steyr style, with a drop down dis-assembly plate positioned forward of the trigger. title: For Sale/Trade:  Mossberg 500 Chainsaw
location: East Side of Lawton, Lawton, Oklahoma
postcontent:
This was my carry weapon before I had CCL and worked some bad neighborhoods a couple years back. Never had to use it, luckily. Now it sits in it's bag on the shelf. I do have a cheap pressure laser and MAG lite mounted that can go with it, plus 30 shells.

Certainly one of the most unusual-looking guns to come out is the Mossberg 500 Chainsaw. Built in the iconic Mossberg 500 action, the Chainsaw is a pistol-grip pump-action shotgun with no stock. While guns like this are desirable for home defense, they're notoriously hard to control while firing, a problem that Mossberg has solved by attaching a wrap-around chainsaw-style hand grip to the pump. Intended to be fired from the hip, this top handle allows the user to cycle the action while simultaneously maintaining leverage above the gun to help tame muzzle flip. In addition to the chainsaw-style grip, the 500 Chainsaw has a stand-off barrel that can be used to breech doors and three rails that can mount accessories.

Specifications:
MODEL	500 Chainsaw
TYPE	Shotgun
ACTION	Pump Action
GAUGE	12 Ga.
CHAMBER	2-3/4" & 3"
BARREL LENGTH	18-1/2"
WEIGHT	6.0 Lbs.
SIGHTS	White Dot

CHOKE	Cylinder Bore

title: For Sale:  Remington 760 "Carbine" in RARE - 280 Rem. Caliber
postcontent: Remington model 760 pump "CARBINE" in the very rare 280 Rem. caliber manufactured in July of 1960; a first year production carbine! These scarce carbines in 280 Rem. cal. were first produced by Remington in July of 1960 according to the Remington records and this firearm was one of the very first with a barrel code of OG (July/1960)!! This little carbine is rare as Rem. records show on 1,222 were manufactured from 1960-1963 in 280 Rem. caliber with CARBINE stamped in large letters on the 18 1/2" barrel!! The factory varnish on the wood is 90% with the loss being on the buttstock end and ribbed forend; metal butt plate still retains original varnish and sling studs have been added to the firearm. Original sights both front and rear and magazine; a plastic dust cover has been added to the receiver to eliminate metal to metal noise during hunting use but I will provide the original"metal dust cover" to the winning bidder. The top of the receiver does reveal slight scope base marks as a scope was used during this firearms hunting history!! A nice Remington firearm for the collector who has always wanted a 280 Rem. CARBINE and has never seen only but a couple for sale!

title: For Sale:  Colt LE901 -16S 901 .308 Carbine
postcontent: Colt LE901-16S™ is the rifle for the hunt. At first glance you would think that the Colt 901 is just a .308 Win./7.62 NATO version of a standard AR-15, much like any other .308 AR out there, but it is a lot more than that. The Colt LE901-16S is a “Modular Carbine,” which means it can be adapted to any AR-15 platform upper. This isn’t a new concept, because there are of course a whole bunch of different caliber uppers for ARs. The difference is in all the other ones, they have adapted a standard size AR magazine to boutique calibers and cartridge designs.

title: For Sale/Trade:  1942 Colt M1911 A1 National Match
postcontent:
RARE 1942 Colt M1911 A1 national match pistol. This is what I know about the gun. Its an original 1942 Colt M 1911 A1 US Army Issue. (matching numbers except slide does not show serial number behind hammer) According to the serial number this gun was shipped in May of 1942. It is stamped with WB inside a Box for Colonel Waldemar S. Broberg, Hartford/Springfield Ordnance District, Army Inspector of Ordnance: July 1, 1941 - June 16, 1942. The WB inspected pistols are a little more rare for that time frame.

Not sure how this gun made it back to the states, but it appears the gun was made into a national match pistol during the 1950's or early 1960's, it does not have "NM" stamped on the slide.. But not all pistols back then were stamped with "NM" for national match. There are two types of Camp Perry National Match pistols.. The kind sent back to Armories and stamped SA for Springfield Armory and NM for Colt Armory. These were tuned, and fitted by the armory for military camp perry match shooting. The second was private gunsmiths these were done in competition with the armories for the same reason. Many prominent Gunsmiths of the time wanted national match recognition and made their own finally tuned pistols. It appears this one might have been done by the military, as the barrel has been re-stamped. This gun is in its original time frame finish (parkerized). All Proof markings to fit era. Bore is excellent and looks shinning.

This pistol is a shooter. It is amazingly tight and special fitted for accuracy. Its an amazing piece of history and looks beautiful as well. Definitely a one of a kind 1911. Would be a prize piece for any collection.

I have many pictures if you want more. FTF in tulsa area only.. All reasonable offers considered. Email if interested. Will trade multiple guns.. Please list your offer and values of guns. email or text 918-four02-zero854.

It is stamped with "FJA" inspector's mark. FJA are the initials of Frank J. Atwood, inspector of ordnance. The "P" proof mark is located near the magazine release and on top of the slide, in front of the rear sight. Cross cannons ordnance mark on the right rear of the frame, to the right of the hammer pin. "UNITED STATES PROPERTY" over the serial number with "M1911A1 U.S. ARMY" to the right of the slide stop pin. Also has the G marking on top of the frame next to the disconnector and P proof mark on top of the slide, in front of the rear sight. HS marked barrel. HS is the marking of High Standard.

This gun is all original, and a wartime piece, as you can tell by the blood spots on the slide and grip. It also comes with original U.S. marked Military issued Holster. This gun still functions perfect, and feeds regular hard ball ammo without fail. A great collector piece for any WWII collection.

I have many pictures if you want more. FTF in tulsa area only.. All reasonable offers considered. Email if interested. Will trade multiple guns.. Please list your offer and values of guns. email or text 918-four02-zero854.
